##########

@@ -1321,8 +1321,17 @@ def test_cancellation(self):
         raise_signal = util.get_raise_signal()
 
         # Make the interruptible workload large enough to not finish

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
Perhaps M1 is too quick :)

Most noticable when running the release verification tasks: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11511

Failing builds:
- https://github.com/ursacomputing/crossbow/runs/3969076907?check_suite_focus=true
- https://github.com/ursacomputing/crossbow/runs/3974036108?check_suite_focus=true#step:5:2014
fields.summary: [Python] CSV test_cancellation unittests fail on Apple M1

comments.body: cc [~alenkaf] since you have an M1, it would be interesting to see if you can reproduce this (and if so, if it is solved by reducing the sleep time)
[~jorisvandenbossche] that would be interesting. We'll do it together as M1 truly is too fast for me :D

Remember I once met with this issue.
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-12241
Looks we should make the workload even larger?
https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/9920
The csv test passes on my M1 in debug or release mode.

I cannot reproduce the error locally either, even after increase the sleep time [1] to 1s.
1.5s does fails the test. I tested on 8 core M1, 16G ram, with AC power connected, release build.

[1] https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/python/pyarrow/tests/test_csv.py#L1328
Perhaps the solution is to dynamically size the workload.
